text: Harold Brown (September 19, 1927 - January 4, 2019) was an American scientist and politician. He was the U.S. Secretary of Defense from 1977 to 1981 in the cabinet of President Jimmy Carter. He last served in the Lyndon Johnson administration as Director of Defense Research and Engineering and Secretary of the Air Force. Brown died of pancreatic cancer on January 4, 2019 at his home in Rancho Santa Fe, California, aged 91. ==References== ==Other websites== *Annotated Bibliography for Harold Brown from the Alsos Digital Library for Nuclear Issues Category:1927 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:United States Secretaries of Defense Category:United States Secretaries of the Air Force Category:American physicians Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
